intro: Hosackia cytisoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf false lupine, is a perennial herb native to the central and western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Hosackia cytisoides plays a role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility in its native ecosystems.
